content.description:
Listed as 5.8 in Bishop Area Rock Climbs 2008. You could climb the route at 5.8, but easier moves exist.

Located to the right of Powerplay, enjoyable face climbing leads past 4 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor.
content.location: Start on top of a bolder and climb enjoyable face to the anchor bolts. Located to the right of Powerplay on the north side of the rocks.

content.description:
This route is not listed in Bishop Area Rock Climbs 2008.  Name of route and FA party unknown at this time.

Located just to the right of Snowball, a single, tough entry move over the roof leads to enjoyable easy face climbing to the Snowball anchors.
content.location: Start just to the right o Snowball.  Rap off from open shuts.

content.description:
This route is not listed in Bishop Area Rock Climbs 2008.

This route is located on the next rock left of Snowball. Name of route and FA party unknown at this time.

Established using non-replaceable wedge-style construction bolts. We found a quicklink at the chains so small I could bend it by hand when open!? Replaced it with a standard 5/16" quicklink and added replaceable links for rapping/lowering.
content.location: South-facing route to the left of Snowball.

content.description:
Burley ugly good from start to finish!

Sharp, grainy, steeper than it looks goodness for all you grain wrestlers out there!
content.protection:
Cammers to 5”

Gear anchor scramble off!
content.location: Obvious short ugly OW 50’ around the corner and to the right of Beer Laps.

content.description: Splitter fingers and tight hands up a clean corner get you in position for the fun slab above!
content.location:
Squeeze through snowman shaped chock stones into corridor just to the right of 2 minutes of hooking.

Route starts from here up the clean corner!

content.description: On the south side of the West Hideout rocks, start up a slabby boulder leading to a roof.  This route surmounts the roof on the right side, and continues up the face above to the anchors (Shuts in December 2008.)  turning the roof is the crux.
A bouldery start leads to enjoyable climbing up a steep face.
content.location: Leftmost of the two routes on the north-facing side of the tower.

content.description: Climb the steepish blocky face just right of Power Squeeze. A few good moves on big holds low down lead to standard fare getting to the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts and shares the anchor with Power Squeeze.
content.location: Located just right of Power Squeeze.

content.description: Start up a low angle slab to the right of Booty Pageant. For inexperienced leaders, a #2 camalot-sized cam is recommended to protect the moves to the first bolt. The steep slab move BEFORE getting to the roof is the crux... the rest of the route is just plain fun, as long as you don't fall doing the step-through. Some loose rock and grainy holds can be expected, this is a new 'Bama Hills route.  Enjoy.
content.location: Located on the south-facing slabs of Hideout West. From the parking area, walk past the 3-bolt 5.6 Unknown route toward Snowball. Look for a bolted route crossing a right-trending roof/chimney/offwidth thingy. You're there.

climbs.name: I Wish I Only Got Two Minutes for Hooking

content.description: Established ground-up, this route ascends a series of isolated red plates. Lots of good holds, but beware of some lingering looseness.
content.protection:
4 lead bolts (1/2" x 4.5" SS wedge)

2-bolt quicklink anchor
content.location:
Line of red-painted bolts on the right edge of the plated slab with

Whippersnapper

(the two routes start on the same boulder).

content.description: Somewhat contrived, but decent short chimney gets you through a tight squeeze/exit to the short face above.
content.location: Located in the short chimney just left of Power Squeeze.

content.description: Steep sustained climbing on good rock. Quite sporty and unfortunately short!
content.location: North side next panel to the right of Whippersnapper and 2 Minutes of Hooking.

climbs.name: Booty Pageant
climbs.fa: Bruce Bindner and Em Holland, January 2009

content.description: A couple thin moves in a few spots on this route. This route climbs the sunny, south facing slabs on the south side of the west Hideout. Only 5.9 if you are taller than 5'8", either way the crux moves are well-protected.
content.location: Look for the south-facing tower to the left of Snowball. Narrow at the bottom, the face widens in a rough inverted triangle. This route climbs the left-hand edge of the face.

content.description: Fun steep climbing through some unique features.
